instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D7010: What is D7010? Diode between ground and gate of Q7010 on 2013-2015 year retina model macbook pros, necessary for Q7010 to allow PPDCIN_G3H to flow through to PP3V42_G3H power supply input. When this diode dies or corrodes, PP3V42_G3H input will not have any voltage, and chargers will not turn on. This can often be the problem if a system only works with a knockoff charger/bench power supply. .
definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .
definitions.SMC_TPAD_RST_L: What is SMC_TPAD_RST_L? SMC_TPAD_RST_L is a signal that comes from the trackpad that can reset the SMC when it is low.  _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v. The trackpad having corrosion from liquid damage is a very common cause of no light on the magsafe charger & the system not turning on, when the trackpad or trackpad cable is corroded and holding this line down. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only charging with fake charger
threads.message:
hello there!
have solved some issues on this already. mainly it was compeltely dead, no green light and no boot. 
has had water damage but im not sure if that was the cause, i have a feeling it was to do with a fake charger to begin with. anyway, to start with i replaced ISL 6259 and also both r005 and r020 were both infinite resistance. 

Now it will boot with a fake charger but not with the original. the original will just pulse on and off green. 
PP3v42 is pulsing of course as well. I have also noticed that there seems to maybe be leakage to ground there. its around 70 ohms to grown on pp3v42

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only charging with fake charger
threads.message: just figured something else out. it's stable with an original charger ONLY if the battery is plugged in

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only charging with fake charger
threads.message:
Leakage on input circuit.

Post exact ohm value for <RESISTOR>R7012</RESISTOR>, measured onboard.
Do the same for <RESISTOR>R7180</RESISTOR>/81 and <RESISTOR>R7185</RESISTOR>/86.

Usually <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR>, or <DIODE>D7010</DIODE> problem.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only charging with fake charger
threads.message: SOLVED, <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR>, realised it was slightly disoclred. thank you!!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only charging with fake charger
threads.message:
Actually, I just realized while the MacBook works, as soon as i hit the power button the SMC resets (turns green) [USER=682]@2informaticos[/USER] 

I also cant use option key to boot from my own drive before startup, it does nothing

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only charging with fake charger
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only charging with fake charger
threads.message: Check <SIGNAL>SMC_TPAD_RST_L</SIGNAL> w/ and w/o trackad flex connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only charging with fake charger
threads.message: thank you!! it was <CHIP>U4850</CHIP>. all sorted. Solved once and for all
